definitions: (of a sentence) imposed by a judge or court but not enforced as long as no further offense is committed within a specified period

examples.text: he was given a suspended prison sentence of 22 months

shortDefinitions: (of sentence) imposed by judge or court but not enforced as long as no further offence is committed within specified period

definitions: (of solid particles) dispersed through the bulk of a fluid

examples.text: suspended sediments inhibit the sun's energy from being used for reef building

shortDefinitions: (of solid particles) dispersed through bulk of fluid

definitions: supported by attachment from above; hanging

examples.text: small vents in the suspended ceilings supply fresh air
suspended walkways and observation platforms high in the treetops
